intro: Labordia sessilis, commonly known as the sessile labordia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
